data.title: Decent place for a quick breakfast.
data.text: Stayed at the Loews and ventured out for a pre-breakfast walk. Decided to grab a ham & cheese croissant and tea at LaProvence. The sales help was friendly and the food was pretty good. Nothing fancy but good.

data.title: Good Break fast option with early morning opening
data.text: Economical and above average in taste. Open very early morning is an advantage. Good staff and above average in taste wise.

data.title: Great for coffee and pastry
data.text: La Provence was our morning stop for coffee and croissants.  Centrally located, open early, and very friendly service!

data.title: Good Breakfast
data.text:
Had family breakfast of Croissants and Breakfast Roll. All very good.  Breakfast Roll was large and packed, enough for two.
Located on Collins Avenue, between 17th and 16th.
Would recommend.

data.title: Breakfast
data.text: Quick service, good choices nice vibe. Croissants and Pain au Chocolate as good as Paris itself. Reasonably priced for Miami Beach location.

data.title: Best breakfast
data.text: This has been one of our favorite place for breakfast. They have the best pastries in town. Their French toast and omelette are to die for. Service is great too. We have visited this place in the years past whenever we visit Miami. Always delicious food.

data.title: Good prices for Miami beach, very good quality food
data.text: We popped in here for brunch one day and had fresh orange juice, croissants, sandwiches and chocolate cake.  The two people serving were very friendly, helpful and patient while we were working out which coins were which in American money.  As with everywhere we encountered in America, prices displayed do not include tax but it was still very reasonable.  The food and drinks were very tasty.

data.title: 5 star service with a smile
data.text: Called in for breakfast as we saw this place was popular. Not only was the food good, we have never experienced such delightful , efficient, cheerful staff. Great choice on the menu. Two breakfasts came to 22 dollars

data.title: nice breakfast
data.text: In september i stayed close to this bakery and went in by chance, honestly everything was great, the atmosphere, variety on the menu and the costumer service is great and organized.

data.title: Amazing sandwiches
data.text: Finally real French food! For breakfast you can get coffee or tea with Fresh baguette, butter and marmelade for only $4. They also have ham and cheese omelet croissants for $9 that come with side salad, very delicious. I had a turnover pastry that was just amazing. Everything we had was fresh. Coffee was freshly brewed and did not taste like it been sitting all day. Staff was very busy but courteous.

data.title: Breakfast in Paris
data.text: While my friend and I were in Miami La Provence became our go to place for breakfast. It brought us back to last year's vacation in Paris. The food is fresh and the coffee is just right! Even after being away for a few days (we headed off to Peru), the owner remembered us from our last visit asking us about our trip.

data.title: Still great for breakfast.
data.text:
We've been fortunate enough to go to SoBe a few times over the past few years and have always enjoyed a good breakfast here. This year we were staying in a rented house in  North Bay Village with friends who we holiday with every year.

We saved visiting here to our last day so the shoppers amongst us could grab some last minute shopping on Lincoln. That, we said, required a good breakfast.

It's fairly easy to miss La Provence if you walk too quickly as its nestled on the ocean side of Collins Avenue.

The menu board is pretty comprehensive and there's an excellent selection of sweet pastries and simply delicious empanadas in addition to fresh fruit,yoghurts, pancakes and eggs done a million ways. In essence, there's something for everyone.

Order at the counter and if you're eating in they give you a hard to miss order number to place on the table. Service is quick.

The portion sizes are excellent and the food is delicious. All washed down with a decent coffee and fresh orange juice.

Again, despite being on Collins, this is a place where the locals go ( with regularity) and that's the acid test. It's not stunningly cheap but suspect that's a combination of the owners sticking to providing quality food and having to cover  the rent for being  where they are on Collins i.e. just by the junction with Lincoln Road.

La Provence is definitely worth considering 😄👍

data.title: Brilliant
data.text: Best for breakfast visited four times this week fab service great choice reasonable pricing and quick service couldn't ask for more will be back

data.title: Good French Bakery Serving Excellent Pannini
data.text: I wanted a quick supper after checking into my hotel.  Always wanted to try this nearby cafe.  Their Pannini was excellent, generous and succulent.  Really hit the spot.  Eclair was good also.  Must try their morning baguette next time.

data.title: Wonderful breakfast place with great pastries and coffee
data.text: We were in South Beach for a week in June and our family of 4 consisting  of my husband and I and our 14 and 12 year olds ate here almost every day.  It was great counter service and coffee and they loved the chocolate croissants and other pastries.  You order and pay at the counter and then get a number that you take to a table and they deliver your order to you. The last day we went was crowded and it was hard to find a table but it definitely is worth the visit.

data.title: Good good
data.text:
Stopped in for a mid -afternoon snack.  Great dessert and coffee treat
Small place- fun location-good price
Beautiful server
Don't miss this place when in Coral Gables

data.title: Nice bakery
data.text: Nice place for a snack or breakfast like we had. Fair prices and omelettes were great. Service was very good as well and right on Collins Ave.

data.title: Amazing pastries!
data.text: The croissants here were fabulous and so flaky. The assortment of pastries we had were all good and we ate breakfast here every day! Drinks are a bit overpriced but the baked good were worth it.

data.title: Afternoon snack: Sweet!
data.text: We were staying at Loews, and I was looking for interesting things nearby. A French bakery fit the bill. My husband picked up a couple of eclairs. The chocolate eclair was good. The vanilla eclair was fantastic! He also bought a couple of beignets for breakfast the following day. Tasty filled donuts but not very beignet-ish if you're expecting Cafe du Monde. Still, I highly recommend the place.

data.title: So Delicious!
data.text: This place is amazing! Quaint and delicious desserts and cafe con Leche! Will come back for sure.. Probably tomorrow :)
